intro: Eberlanzia vulnerans, commonly known as the bleeding heart plant, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and striking pink to red flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires partial to full sunlight. Eberlanzia vulnerans is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
